page.title: 04A Typical Adults day
page.content: I get up at 7.30, call the rest of the family and then we all have breakfast. My husband takes myself and our 2 daughters to school on his way to work. I am employed as an ancillary at Great Barton School and have various roles to perform. In the afternoon I go to Bury where I am a voluntary worker in a Youth Enquiry Shop, I try to help young people (14-26) with various pro- blems, and hopefully am of some use to them. At 3.00pm I catch a bus from Bury which drops me outside the school in time to pick my 2 daughtersand take them home. At approx 5.30 my husband comes home from his job as a Community Education Officer, and we all have tea at 6.00pm. By 8.00pm my daughters are in bed and I have the last few hours of my day just relaxing by reading a book of watching television. In the Summer I spend most of my time in the garden.
